Austin's Dirty Little Secret... It Kinda Sucks

I'm a Technical Lead for Schwab web technologies specializing in leading Agile technology teams delivering high quality solutions using a full stack of technologies including JavaScript frameworks Backbone and Angular as well as Microsoft MVC and supporting older frameworks like Web Forms. My job is to own and deliver superior web solutions for our business partners by leading a group of front end developers through governance processes and domain interactions as well as code reviews, analysis, metrics and security reviews all while maintaining a schedule that exceeds delivery expectations.Technologies: JavaScript (Angular & Backbone), C# (MVC & ASP.Net)
Distributed server software development for advanced trading systems
Developed software for testing and approving CyberTrader's trading applications
recommendations: February 16, 2009, Michael was senior to Ryan but didn’t manage directly

Ryan is truly one of the best developers that I have worked with in my career.  Not only is he good because of his technical skills which are outstanding, but also because of his work ethic.  He strongly believes in doing things the right way the first time.  He does the job right so that it does not have to be redone again and again.  Ryan has gone into code sections of complex financial logic that nobody else wanted to even touch and improve performance by several hundred percent as well as cleaned up the logic to where it was easy for other developers to understand and maintain.  In addition to his technical knowledge, Ryan has an understanding of financial systems that sets him apart from the rest.  He is able to work well with those around him and is a dedicated employee.  Ryan is an excellent model for others to follow, and I hope that I get the honor of working with him again in the future.

January 29, 2009, Michael was senior to Ryan but didn’t manage directly

I had the very distinct pleasure of working closely with Michael Rundell for 8 years.  During that time Mike continued to innovate and improve upon one of the industry’s leading distributed software trading systems.  When it comes to the exchange facing services, his knowledge is unparalleled, and quite frankly an irreplaceable asset.  Michael was at the forefront, always available before market open, and eagerly looking to help in any way to make sure that Charles Schwab’s exchange facing software solutions were not just working but working at their optimum.  Michael is quite skilled in developing bulletproof, flexible, innovative software solutions.   For example, Michael’s solution for an exchange simulation application was to generate something that would be easily updated and extended using methods other than code change.  Anyone in the industry knows that exchanges in the market are in constant flux, so finding a solution that didn’t require frequent code changes was necessary unless you wanted a full time employee working on code changes.  His solution was also beneficial in that it allowed our QA department to easily manipulate the exchanges messaging from the UI to more thoroughly test our trading system.  This is a rather simplistic example, but the point is that Michael is constantly looking to generate software that takes in all the variables and adjust the solution to find the best possible fit for the situation as a whole.Michael places his work and business ethic above all else.   When others would look for a software solution that would get them home by 5pm, or a solution that kept them working on their proprietary technologies, Michael was looking for the best solution for the company and his co-workers.I would work with Michael again in a heartbeat.  There are only a handful of individuals that I would want to work with again, and there are even fewer that I would eagerly work with again.  Michael easily fits into the second category.

Every once in a while we have the opportunity to work with a select few who really know what they're doing.  Aaron definitely fits this mold.I can easily say that Aaron was one of the best managers I've had the privilege to work with.
